description.narrative: IR 2.1 Community WASH 2012 - Children and women, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from increased and sustainable Water and Sanitation services and are enabled to adopt improved hygiene practices, including in schools and emergencies.

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
Water supply in emergencies - improving water supply services communities

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.1 Community WASH 2012 - Children and women, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from increased and sustainable Water and Sanitation services and are enabled to adopt improved hygiene practices, including in schools and emergencies.
# of conflict IDP's reached with Safe drinking water,sanitation facilities and Hygiene promotion
# of people with access to basic and improved sanitation, of which #of people have been reached through scaling-up of rural sanitation.
Disaster management authorities and other relevant institutions at federal, provincial and district levels strengthened in emergency preparednesss and response
Increased use of child-friendly water and sanitation facilities in 5% of boys and girls schools in select districts
5% more household caregivers know about safe hygiene practices from baseline in selected districts
